name: Splunk IT Service Intelligence for SOAR
description: This app integrates with Splunk IT Service Intelligence to provide operations on Splunk IT Service Intelligence episodes, services, entities, and object maintenance

base_url.description: Splunk ITSI Search Head Base URL

port.description: Splunk ITSI Search Head Management Port

actions.verbose: If 'start time' and 'relative start time' both will be provided, the 'start time' will be given priority. Same as if 'end time' and 'relative end time' both will be provided, the 'end time' will be given priority.

relative_start_time.description: Relative start time in seconds. To start maintenance window now - 0, to start maintenance window after 5 mins - 300, to start maintenance window after 1 hour - 3600

relative_end_time.description: Relative end time in seconds. To end maintenance window in 1 min from now - 60, to end maintenance window after 5 mins - 300, to end maintenance window after 1 hour - 3600

actions.verbose: If 'start time' and 'relative start time' both will be provided, the 'start time' will be given priority. Same as if 'end time' and 'relative end time' both will be provided, the 'end time' will be given priority.

relative_start_time.description: Relative start time in seconds. To start maintenance window now - 0, to start maintenance window after 5 mins - 300, to start maintenance window after 1 hour - 3600

relative_end_time.description: Relative end time in seconds. To end maintenance window in 1 min from now - 60, to end maintenance window after 5 mins - 300, to end maintenance window after 1 hour - 3600

actions.description: Get Splunk ITSI maintenance window information

example_values: Status: Successfully updated the service status

actions.description: Get entities of a Splunk ITSI service

example_values: Status: Successfully retrieved the service entities

actions.verbose: The KPI count in the output table will always be created KPIs + 1 (inbuilt ServiceHealthScore KPI).

example_values: `get_full_itsi_summary_service_health_events(61866623-79bb-4be0-a0c6-fa549a225b1a)` [| stats count | addinfo | eval search= "earliest=" + tostring(info_min_time-(info_max_time-info_min_time))+ " latest=" + tostring(info_max_time) |fields search] | addinfo | eval bucket=if(_time<info_max_time-((info_max_time-info_min_time)/2), "last_window", "current_window") | stats avg(health_score) AS aggregate BY bucket | reverse | delta aggregate AS window_delta | search bucket=current_window | eval window_direction=if(window_delta >0, "increase", if(window_delta < 0, "decrease", "none"))

actions.description: Get ticket information for a Splunk ITSI episode
Add a ticket to a Splunk ITSI episode
actions.verbose: Include http:// or https:// in the 'ticket url' action parameter. Otherwise the URL is interpreted as a relative URI.

ticket_id.description: Ticket ID in the ticketing system

ticket_url.description: Ticket URL in the ticketing system

actions.description: Get latest events for Splunk ITSI episode

earliest_time.description: Earliest time to search. Select from the drop down or enter relative time modifiers - -60m for 60 minutes ago, -24h for 24 hours ago. Ref: https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/8.0.1/Search/Specifytimemodifiersinyoursearch

max_results.description: Max results retrieved by the search

example_values: Test App - System Health App Run Failures severity changed from medium to low
